ABNF.html: Augmented BNF for Syntax Specifications: ABNF (URL: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/std/std68.txt), D. Crocker, P. Overell. IETF.
titles: Augmented BNF for Syntax Specifications: ABNF

ABOUT.notes: Used to add a couple specific locations to the about scheme, resilient to broader changes made there.

ARIA.html: Accessible Rich Internet Applications (WAI-ARIA) (URL: http://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria/), J. Craig, M. Cooper, L. Pappas, R. Schwerdtfeger, L. Seeman. W3C.
ARIA.notes: Imports role and aria-* attributes and defines the binding, but relying on naming.

ARIAIMPL.html: WAI-ARIA 1.0 User Agent Implementation Guide (URL: http://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-implementation/), J. Scheuhammer, M. Cooper, A. Snow-Weaver, M. Cooper. W3C.

BCP47.html: Tags for Identifying Languages; Matching of Language Tags (URL: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/bcp/bcp47.txt), A. Phillips, M. Davis. IETF.
titles: Tags for Identifying Languages; Matching of Language Tags
BCP47.notes: Changes to BCP47 would have no impact on the specification, it is treated as an open-ended set.

BIDI.html: UAX #9: Unicode Bidirectional Algorithm (URL: http://www.unicode.org/reports/tr9/), M. Davis, A. Lanin, A. Glass. Unicode Consortium.
BIDI.notes: Changes to BIDI could possibly require changes to some parts of the specification that interact with bidirectionality.

CANVAS2D.html:
• HTML Canvas 2D Context (URL: http://www.w3.org/TR/2dcontext/), R. Cabanier, E. Graff, J. Munro, T. Wiltzius. W3C.
  • HTML Canvas 2D Context, Level 2 Nightly (URL: http://www.w3.org/html/wg/drafts/2dcontext/master/), R. Cabanier, J. Mann, J. Munro, T. Wiltzius. W3C.
CANVAS2D.notes: Indicates how to interface with 2D canvases, but is resilient to changes made there.

CLDR.html: Unicode Common Locale Data Repository (URL: http://cldr.unicode.org/). Unicode.
CLDR.notes: Data in the specification is imported and generated from the CLDR. It can easily be updated, though.

COOKIES.html: HTTP State Management Mechanism (URL: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6265), A. Barth. IETF.

CORS.html: Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (URL: http://www.w3.org/TR/access-control/), A. van Kesteren. W3C.
CORS.notes: Used in fetching, changes would likely have an impact.

CSS.html: Cascading Style Sheets Level 2 Revision 1 (URL: http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS2/), B. Bos, T. Çelik, I. Hickson, H. Lie. W3C.
CSS.notes: Used in several places, but not absolutely required. Breaking changes are not possible.

CSSATTR.html: CSS Styling Attribute Syntax (URL: http://www.w3.org/TR/css-style-attr/), T. Çelik, E. Etemad. W3C.

CSSCOLOR.html: CSS Color Module Level 3 (URL: http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-color/), T. Çelik, C. Lilley, L. Baron. W3C.

CSSIMAGES.html:
• CSS Image Values and Replaced Content Module Level 3 (URL: http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-images/), E. Etemad, T. Atkins. W3C.
  • CSS Image Values and Replaced Content Module (URL: http://dev.w3.org/csswg/css-images/), E. Etemad, T. Atkins. W3C.
titles: CSS Image Values and Replaced Content Module Level 3
CSS Image Values and Replaced Content Module
CSSIMAGES.notes: Used essentially for definitions of things that cannot be broken.

CSSOM.html:
• Document Object Model (DOM) Level 2 Style (URL: http://www.w3.org/TR/DOM-Level-2-Style/), C. Wilson, P. Le Hégaret, V. Apparao. W3C.
  • Cascading Style Sheets Object Model (CSSOM) (URL: http://dev.w3.org/csswg/cssom/), S. Pieters, G. Adams. W3C.

CSSOMVIEW.html:
• Document Object Model (DOM) Level 2 Style (URL: http://www.w3.org/TR/DOM-Level-2-Style/), C. Wilson, P. Le Hégaret, V. Apparao. W3C.
  • CSSOM View Module (URL: http://dev.w3.org/csswg/cssom-view/), S. Pieters, G. Adams. W3C.

DOM.html: DOM (URL: http://www.w3.org/TR/dom/), A. van Kesteren, A. Gregor, Ms2ger, A. Russell, R. Berjon. W3C.
DOM.notes: Relied upon a lot. That said, the features being relied upon are not of the type that can be broken without breaking content and implementations; and the relationship is essentially through clean interfaces. The case could be made that this is in fact a weak mapping.

DOMEVENTS.html:
• Document Object Model (DOM) Level 2 Events (URL: http://www.w3.org/TR/DOM-Level-2-Events/), T. Pixley. W3C.
  • Document Object Model (DOM) Level 3 Events Specification (URL: https://dvcs.w3.org/hg/dom3events/raw-file/tip/html/DOM3-Events.html), T. Leithead, J. Rossi, D. Schepers, B. Höhrmann, P. Le Hégaret, T. Pixley. W3C.
titles: Document Object Model (DOM) Level 3 Events Specification
DOMEVENTS.notes: Relied upon in a number of places; but the support in Level 2 is sufficient.

DOMPARSING.html: DOM Parsing and Serialization (URL: http://www.w3.org/TR/DOM-Parsing/), T. Leithead. Work in Progress. W3C.
DOMPARSING.notes: Some attributes are imported by name.

ECMA262.notes: Some relatively tight binding is used.

ENCODING.html: Encoding (URL: http://www.w3.org/TR/encoding/), A. van Kesteren, J. Bell, A. Phillips. W3C.
ENCODING.notes: While relied upon a lot, the ties are cleanly bridged and changes to this specification would not require changes to HTML.

FILEAPI.notes: Imports interfaces, mostly relies on names. Broadly implemented in a manner that cannot be broken.

HTTP.html:
HTTP is the union of a set of RFCs:
  • Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP/1.1): Message Syntax and Routing (URL: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7230), R. Fielding, J. Reschke. IETF.
  • Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP/1.1): Semantics and Content (URL: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231), R. Fielding, J. Reschke. IETF.
  • Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP/1.1): Conditional Requests (URL: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7232), R. Fielding, J. Reschke. IETF.
  • Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP/1.1): Range Requests (URL: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7233), R. Fielding, Y. Lafon, J. Reschke. IETF.
  • Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP/1.1): Caching (URL: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7234), R. Fielding, M. Nottingham, J. Reschke. IETF.
  • Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP/1.1): Authentication (URL: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7235), R. Fielding, J. Reschke. IETF.
titles: Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP/1.1): Message Syntax and Routing
Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP/1.1): Semantics and Content
HTTP.notes: Used extensively, though the interfacing is clean enough that this could be considered a weak reference.

IANAPERMHEADERS.html: Permanent Message Header Field Names (URL: http://www.iana.org/assignments/message-headers/message-headers.xhtml). IANA.

MATHML.html: Mathematical Markup Language (MathML) (URL: http://www.w3.org/TR/MathML/), D. Carlisle, P. Ion, R. Miner, N. Poppelier. W3C.
MATHML.notes: Imported cleanly with no local impact.

MEDIAFRAG.html: Media Fragments URI 1.0 (URL: http://www.w3.org/TR/media-frags/), R. Troncy, E. Mannens, S. Pfeiffer, D. Van Deursen. W3C.

MIMESNIFF.html: Media Type Sniffing (URL: http://tools.ietf.org/html/draft-ietf-websec-mime-sniff-03), A. Barth, I. Hickson. IETF.
MIMESNIFF.notes: The specification is very clear that Sniffing must be supported, but it delegates all the actual work to the reference. This is also not something that can be changed without breaking content.

MPEG2.html: <cite>ISO/IEC 13818-1: Information technology — Generic coding of moving pictures and associated audio information: Systems</cite>. ISO/IEC.
titles: ISO/IEC 13818-1: Information technology — Generic coding of moving pictures and associated audio information: Systems
MPEG2.notes: Cleanly delegates the extraction of some information to the reference.

MPEG4.html: <cite>ISO/IEC 14496-12: ISO base media file format</cite>. ISO/IEC.
titles: ISO/IEC 14496-12: ISO base media file format
MPEG4.notes: Cleanly delegates the extraction of some information to the reference.

MQ.html: Media Queries (URL: http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-mediaqueries/), H. Lie, T. Çelik, D. Glazman, A. van Kesteren. W3C.
MQ.notes: Support is required, but usage is by reference. Widely deployed.

OGGSKELETONHEADERS.notes: Cleanly delegates the extraction of some information to the reference.

OPENSEARCH.html: Autodiscovery in HTML/XHTML (URL: http://www.opensearch.org/Specifications/OpenSearch/1.1#Autodiscovery_in_HTML.2FXHTML). In OpenSearch 1.1 Draft 4, Section 4.6.2. OpenSearch.org.

ORIGIN.html: The Web Origin Concept (URL: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6454), A. Barth. IETF.

PNG.html: Portable Network Graphics (PNG) Specification (URL: http://www.w3.org/TR/PNG/), D. Duce. W3C.

PROGRESS-EVENTS.html: Progress Events (URL: http://www.w3.org/TR/progress-events/), A. van Kesteren, C. McCathie Nevile; J. Song. W3C.
PROGRESS-EVENTS.notes: Interfaces cleanly to the processing of progress events.

RFC1034.html: Domain Names - Concepts and Facilities (URL: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1034), P. Mockapetris. IETF, November 1987.

RFC1123.html: Requirements for Internet Hosts -- Application and Support (URL: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1123), R. Braden. IETF, October 1989.
titles: Requirements for Internet Hosts -- Application and Support

RFC2046.html: Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) Part Two: Media Types (URL: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2046), N. Freed, N. Borenstein. IETF.
titles: Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) Part Two: Media Types
RFC2046.notes: Mostly imported cleanly. There is a wilful violation but were the reference to change that would not break the override.

RFC2119.html: Key words for use in RFCs to Indicate Requirement Levels (URL: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2119), S. Bradner. IETF.
titles: Key words for use in RFCs to Indicate Requirement Levels
RFC2119.notes: The relationship is strong, but at this point changing the meaning of keywords would break most standards.

RFC2318.html: The text/css Media Type (URL: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2318), H. Lie, B. Bos, C. Lilley. IETF.
RFC2318.notes: Just a pointer for the default value of the styling language.

RFC2388.html: Returning Values from Forms: multipart/form-data (URL: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2388), L. Masinter. IETF.

RFC2483.html: URI Resolution Services Necessary for URN Resolution (URL: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2483), M. Mealling, R. Daniel. IETF.
titles: URI Resolution Services Necessary for URN Resolution
RFC2483.notes: Just imports the media type name.

RFC3676.html: The Text/Plain Format and DelSp Parameters (URL: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3676), R. Gellens. IETF.
titles: The Text/Plain Format and DelSp Parameters

RFC3023.html: XML Media Types (URL: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3023), M. Murata, S. St. Laurent, D. Kohn. IETF.

RFC3279.html: Algorithms and Identifiers for the Internet X.509 Public Key Infrastructure Certificate and Certificate Revocation List (CRL) Profile (URL: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3279), W. Polk, R. Housley, L. Bassham. IETF.
titles: Algorithms and Identifiers for the Internet X.509 Public Key Infrastructure Certificate and Certificate Revocation List (CRL) Profile

RFC3490.html: Internationalizing Domain Names in Applications (IDNA) (URL: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3490), P. Faltstrom, P. Hoffman, A. Costello. IETF.

RFC3629.html: UTF-8, a transformation format of ISO 10646 (URL: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3629), F. Yergeau. IETF.
titles: UTF-8, a transformation format of ISO 10646

RFC4281.html: The Codecs Parameter for "Bucket" Media Types (URL: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4281), R. Gellens, D. Singer, P. Frojdh. IETF.
titles: The Codecs Parameter for "Bucket" Media Types

RFC4395.html: Guidelines and Registration Procedures for New URI Schemes (URL: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4395), T. Hansen, T. Hardie, L. Masinter. IETF.
titles: Guidelines and Registration Procedures for New URI Schemes
RFC4395.notes: Mentioned for the definition of the web+ scheme family.

RFC4648.html: The Base16, Base32, and Base64 Data Encodings (URL: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4648), S. Josefsson. IETF.
titles: The Base16, Base32, and Base64 Data Encodings

RFC5280.html: Internet X.509 Public Key Infrastructure Certificate and Certificate Revocation List (CRL) Profile (URL: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5280), D. Cooper, S. Santesson, S. Farrell, S. Boeyen, R. Housley, W. Polk. IETF.
titles: Internet X.509 Public Key Infrastructure Certificate and Certificate Revocation List (CRL) Profile

RFC6266.html: Use of the Content-Disposition Header Field in the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) (URL: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6266), J. Reschke. IETF.
titles: Use of the Content-Disposition Header Field in the Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP)

SELECTORS.notes: Provides concrete bindings to implement selectors in HTML, cannot be broken.

SRGB.html: IEC 61966-2-1: Multimedia systems and equipment — Colour measurement and management — Part 2-1: Colour management — Default RGB colour space — sRGB (URL: http://webstore.iec.ch/webstore/webstore.nsf/artnum/025408!OpenDocument&Click=). IEC.
titles: IEC 61966-2-1: Multimedia systems and equipment — Colour measurement and management — Part 2-1: Colour management — Default RGB colour space — sRGB

SVG.html: Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG) 1.1 (Second Edition) (URL: http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/), E. Dahlström et al. W3C.
SVG.notes: Has some relatively strong ties in some places, but these cannot be broken without breaking deployed content.

TYPEDARRAY.html: Typed Array Specification (URL: https://www.khronos.org/registry/typedarray/specs/1.0/), D. Herman, K. Russell. Khronos.

URL.notes: Imports definitions and interfaces, but orthogonally. URLs cannot be broken without breaking the Web.

WEBIDL.notes: Relied-upon, but the syntax-only approach is favoured for this specific reference.

WSP.html: The WebSocket protocol (URL: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6455), I. Fette, A. Melnikov. IETF.

X690.html: Recommendation X.690 — Information Technology — ASN.1 Encoding Rules — Specification of Basic Encoding Rules (BER), Canonical Encoding Rules (CER), and Distinguished Encoding Rules (DER) (URL: http://www.itu.int/ITU-T/studygroups/com17/languages/X.690-0207.pdf). International Telecommunication Union.
titles: Recommendation X.690 — Information Technology — ASN.1 Encoding Rules — Specification of Basic Encoding Rules (BER), Canonical Encoding Rules (CER), and Distinguished Encoding Rules (DER)

XML.html: Extensible Markup Language (URL: http://www.w3.org/TR/xml/), T. Bray, J. Paoli, C. Sperberg-McQueen, E. Maler, F. Yergeau. W3C.
XML.notes: All interfacing is through clean references; one (small, arguable) wilful violation to note for template processing.

XMLBASE.html: XML Base (URL: http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlbase/), J. Marsh, R. Tobin. W3C.

XMLNS.html: Namespaces in XML (URL: http://www.w3.org/TR/xml-names/), T. Bray, D. Hollander, A. Layman, R. Tobin. W3C.

XPATH10.html: XML Path Language (XPath) Version 1.0 (URL: http://www.w3.org/TR/1999/REC-xpath-19991116), J. Clark, S. DeRose. W3C.
XPATH10.notes: Import, though with one notable wilful violation.
